items.q: Who was the leader of the Haitian Revolution, which led to the first free colonial society rejecting race as the basis of social ranking?
items.explanation: He successfully transformed a slave insurgency into a revolutionary movement.

items.q: The Holy Roman Empire was effectively dissolved following the Napoleonic Wars in 1806.
items.explanation: Emperor Francis II abdicated after the decisive Battle of Austerlitz.

items.q: The Sepoy Mutiny (or First War of Indian Independence) occurred against French colonial rule in India.
items.explanation: It was against the British East India Company in 1857.

items.q: What is the name of the period in Japanese history (794 to 1185) noted for its highly refined art, poetry, and literature at the imperial court?
items.explanation: The 'Tale of Genji' was written during this time.

items.q: Who was the prominent Carthaginian commander known for his brilliant tactics at the Battle of Cannae during the Second Punic War?
items.explanation: Cannae is considered one of the greatest tactical masterpieces in military history.

items.q: What conference in 1884-1885 regulated European colonization and trade in Africa, launching the 'Scramble for Africa'?
items.explanation: It disregarded existing linguistic and cultural boundaries.

items.q: What was the system of forced labor imposed by the Spanish on indigenous peoples in the Americas?
items.explanation: It granted conquerors the right to extract tribute and labor.

items.q: Who was the dominant figure of the Congress of Vienna, a conservative Austrian statesman seeking to restore pre-Napoleonic borders?
What was the name of the catastrophic famine in Ireland during the mid-19th century caused by potato blight?
items.a: The Great Famine (or Irish Potato Famine)
items.explanation: It caused massive emigration and up to a million deaths.

items.q: What was the final, decisive battle of the Vietnam War involving French forces in 1954?
items.a: The Battle of Dien Bien Phu
items.explanation: The French defeat led to their withdrawal from Indochina.
